biblinkcreator

Class DataExtractor

  • java.lang.Object
    • biblinkcreator.DataExtractor

  • public class DataExtractor
extends java.lang.Object
    A mechanism that extracts preprocesses and saves bibliographic data retrieved from semantic repositories.

    Author: David Nazarian

                     DataStructure.StringFormatData sourceAStringFormatData,
                     Logger logger)
        Parameters:
        sourceARepositoryInfo - Information about the source repository providing the subjects of the links.
        destRepositoryInfo - Information about the destination repository where the extracted and preprocessed data will be transferred to.
        sourceAStringFormatData - Extra preprocessing information for the identifiers extracted from the source repository providing the subject of the links.
        logger - A logger that will log generated messages.

      • extractData

        public int extractData(java.lang.String sourceAExtractionQuery,
                       java.lang.String sourceBExtractionQuery,
                       DataStructure.RepositoryInfo sourceBRepositoryInfo,
                       Identifier.IdentifierType identifierType,
                       boolean saveNewDataOnly,
                       DataStructure.StringFormatData sourceBStringFormatData)
        Extracts, preprocesses records from the two source repositories providing data for the formation of the subjects and objects of the links, and saves them into the destination repository.
        Parameters:
        sourceAExtractionQuery - A SPARQL query which will extract the records from the source repository providing the subjects of the links. Its select clause must contain a variable for the subject, the identifier, the title and optionally for the publication year (except for the issn and the journalTitle identifiers for which it is mandatory). The variable names are the following:
        Variable name for the subject: ?subject
        Variable name for the title: ?title
        Variable name for the publication year: ?year
        The variable names for the identifiers can be retrieved by using the getIdentifierVariableName method of the identifier class.

        An example of a select clause for record retrieval:

        SELECT
            ?subject
            ?isbn
            ?title
            ?year


        or a select everything can be used instead:

        SELECT *
        sourceBExtractionQuery - A SPARQL query which will extract the records from the source repository providing the objects of the links. Its select clause is similar to the one described previously. The variable subject will retrieve the URIs that will form the objects of the links.
        sourceBRepositoryInfo - Information about the source repository providing the objects of the links.
        identifierType - The type of the identifier to be used for the extraction from the two sources.
        saveNewDataOnly - Excludes the identifiers, data for which have been already saved once.
        sourceBStringFormatData - Extra preprocessing information for the data extracted from the source repository providing the objects of the links.
        Returns:
        The number of saved records from the repository that providing the objects of the links.

      • getIdentifierSet

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getIdentifierSet(java.lang.String extractionQuery,
                                                        org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryConnection sourceRepositoryConn,
                                                        Identifier.IdentifierType identifierType,
                                                        boolean formatIdentifier,
                                                        DataStructure.StringFormatData stringFormatData)
        Gets an identifier set by extracting data from the source repository. The identifiers of the set can either be in a raw form (as retrieved from the repository) or formatted.
        Parameters:
        extractionQuery - A SPARQL query which will extract the identifiers from the source repository. Its select clause must contain a variable with the name of the identifier, e.g. ?isbn. The variable names for the identifiers can be retrieved by using the getIdentifierVariableName method of the Identifier class.
        sourceRepositoryConn - A repository connection to the source repository from where the identifiers will be extracted.
        identifierType - The type of the identifier to be extracted.
        formatIdentifier - A value indicating if the identifiers will be formatted after the retrieval from the repository or not.
        stringFormatData - (Optional) Extra preprocessing information for the identifiers extracted from the source repository.
        Returns:
        An identifier set.

      • getFormattedIdentifierSet

        public DataStructure.ExtractionResult getFormattedIdentifierSet(java.lang.String extractionQuery,
                                                                org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryConnection sourceRepositoryConn,
                                                                java.util.Set<java.lang.String> inclusionSet,
                                                                java.util.Set<java.lang.String> exclusionSet,
                                                                Identifier.IdentifierType identifierType,
                                                                DataStructure.StringFormatData stringFormatData)
        Gets an extraction result which contains a formatted identifier set and a count for the invalid identifiers encountered during the extraction of data from the source repository. The formatted identifier set can be narrowed by an exclusion set and be controlled by an inclusion set regarding its content.
        Parameters:
        extractionQuery - A SPARQL query which will extract the identifiers from the source repository. Its select clause must contain a variable with the name of the identifier, e.g. ?isbn. The variable names for the identifiers can be retrieved by using the getIdentifierVariableName method of the Identifier class.
        sourceRepositoryConn - A repository connection to the source repository from where the identifiers will be extracted and preprocessed.
        inclusionSet - (Optional) A set of identifiers which will control the content of the result set. Only identifiers retrieved by the extractionQuery that exist in this set can be added to the result set.
        exclusionSet - (Optional) A set of identifiers which will narrow the content of the result set. The identifiers retrieved by the extractionQuery that exist in this set will be omitted from the result set.
        identifierType - The type of the identifier to be extracted.
        stringFormatData - (Optional) Extra preprocessing information for the identifiers extracted from the source repository.
        Returns:
        An extraction result which contains a formatted identifier set and a count for the invalid identifiers encountered.
